org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.fastq

Enum FastqReadNameEncoding

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<FastqReadNameEncoding>
      • org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.fastq.FastqReadNameEncoding
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<FastqReadNameEncoding>

    public enum FastqReadNameEncoding
extends java.lang.Enum<FastqReadNameEncoding>
    Enum for encoding of the read name in the FASTQ format. Some of this names contain important information that cannot be lost in the processing step. Because there are very strict formatting of headers in the BAM file, processing read names from FASTQ files is important for lossy transformation.

      • isPF

        public boolean isPF(java.lang.String readName)
        Gets the PF flag from the read name.

        Note: this information is only encoded in the CASAVA formatting.

        Parameters:
        readName - the read name.
        Returns:
        true if 'Y' is found in CASAVA formatting; false otherwise.

      • getPairedState

        public java.lang.String getPairedState(java.lang.String readName)
        Returns the paired state for this read (0, 1 or 2).
        Parameters:
        readName - the read name to extract the pair state.
        Returns:
        the pair state 1 or 2; 0 if not information.

      • isSecondOfPair

        public boolean isSecondOfPair(java.lang.String readName)
        Returns the second of pair status of the read.

        Note: false does not mean that the read is not paired or have the '1' mark.

        Parameters:
        readName - the read name to extract the information.
        Returns:
        true if the read have the '2' mark; false otherwise.

      • isFirstOfPair

        public boolean isFirstOfPair(java.lang.String readName)
        Returns the first of pair status of the read.

        Note: false does not mean that the read is not paired or have the '2' mark.

        Parameters:
        readName - the read name to extract the information.
        Returns:
        true if the read have the '1' mark; false otherwise.

      • getBarcodes

        public java.lang.String[] getBarcodes(java.lang.String readName)
        Returns the barcodes in the read name (splitted by RTReadUtils.DEFAULT_BARCODE_INDEX_SPLIT).
        Parameters:
        readName - the read name to extract the information.
        Returns:
        the barcodes in the read name; empty array if information is not present.

      • updateReadFromReadName

        public static void updateReadFromReadName(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                          java.lang.String readName)
        Detects the format for the read name provided, and updates the read information.

        The following information will be updated:

        • Read name according to SAM specs (no barcode or pair-end information), without white-space.
        • Pair-end information in the bitwise flag (using getPairedState(String)).
        • PF information in the bitwise flag (using isPF(String)).
        • Barcode information in the default tag (using getBarcodes(String)).
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update.
        readName - the read name from a FASTQ file.
